summary: This is an email from an FBI Special Agent summarizing the findings from a search of Jeffrey Epstein's suitcases, which revealed multiple U.S. passports and a fraudulent Austrian passport under an alias. The email also mentions a novelty U.S. Treasury Customs Service badge. The document is significant as it provides direct evidence of Epstein's use of false identity documents.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual whose suitcases were searched, found to possess multiple U.S. passports and a fraudulent Austrian passport under the alias Marius Robert Fortelni.

persons.name: Marius Robert Fortelni
persons.context: The name listed on a Republic of Austria passport found in Epstein's possession, with a listed residence in Saudi Arabia and a date of birth of July 30, 1954.

connections.description: Epstein possessed a fraudulent Austrian passport issued under the alias Marius Robert Fortelni, indicating the use of a false identity.

events.title: Email reporting passport findings
events.description: An FBI Special Agent sends an email reporting the results of reviewing suitcases belonging to Jeffrey Epstein, which contained multiple passports and a novelty badge.

locations: Saudi Arabia (listed residence on fraudulent Austrian passport)
keyFacts: Five U.S. passports and one Republic of Austria passport were found in Jeffrey Epstein's suitcases.
The Austrian passport was issued under the alias 'Marius Robert Fortelni' with a listed residence in Saudi Arabia and a date of birth of July 30, 1954.
A U.S. Department of Treasury Customs Service badge/pin was found, described as a novelty item with no accompanying credentials.
The email is from an FBI Special Agent assigned to the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force in New York.
The document provides direct physical evidence of Epstein's possession of false identity documents.
